result.execSummary:
The defendant Denasia N Danzy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision:  all court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA; all applicable fees of supervision.  Bail to appy..
To be paid from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
*Restitution set at zero.

Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.

**12-19-14/Decision**
Court grants the defense motion for expungement. Upon successful completion of the sentence, Court will consider motion for expungement.

superMiscConds.notes: Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
AODA assessment. Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm; and that she may not vote until her civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Denasia N Danzy

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (29 pages) commencing 10/20/2014 SENTENCING HEARING received and filed.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Denasia N Danzy not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for decision.  For reasons stated on the record, the Court GRANTS the defense motion for expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence Court will consider motion for expungement.

Defendant Denasia N Danzy in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Denasia N Danzy in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.
Court will consider defense motion for expungement.  Briefing schedule as follows: Defense brief due 11/19/2014, State's response due 12/10/2014.  Case adjourned for decision in Branch 22.

Defendant Denasia N Danzy in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Denasia N Danzy in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by:  MPD Detective Eric Draeger.

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3.5 YEARS with 217 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1.5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the Earned Release program.  

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution set at zero;
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied.
-  The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that she may not vote until her civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence    
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Denasia N Danzy in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Denasia N Danzy in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that her voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.

Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defense requests, and the DA approves moving the next court date up to 10/02/2014 at 1:30pm.  However, original date of 10/20/2014 is kept on Branch 22's calendar because the DA may be at a conference 10/02/2014.
Parties previously contacted the court asking that the jury trial date of 10/20/2014 be converted to a projected guilty plea date.  Final pre-trial on 10/10/2014 is canceled.

Attorney Mary G Guimont in court, defendant Denasia N Danzy not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Final pre-trial scheduled for 10-10-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Denasia N Danzy in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Joy M Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Bail motion by defense argued and DENIED by the Court.
For reasons stated off and on the record, Plea and Sentencing adjourned to a later date in Branch 22. Plea and Sentencing scheduled for 07-07-2014 at 08:30am.

Defendant Denasia N Danzy in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Denasia N Danzy in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
For reasons stated off the record to the Court, Final adjournment of Plea and Sentencing Hearing scheduled for 06-20-2014 at 08:30am.
Justice Point Discharge Summary, as to 14CF644 and 14CF1065, FILED.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Denasia N Danzy not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea and Sentencing adjourned to a later date in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 05-12-2014 at 08:30 am.

14RM011995  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
2/28/14 vf
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Denasia N Danzy in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 3/3/14.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Denasia N Danzy not in court, in custody.  Joy M Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
For reasons stated off the record to the Court, action in this matter scheduled for Plea and Sentencing along with Cases 13CF5268, 14CF235, and along with Case 13CM5339 which Judge Witkowiak has agreed to take as part of a global resolution, with Judge Thomas McAdam's agreement.  Madam Clerk, Catrina, Branch 07 was informed that Branch 22 has agreed to take 13CM5339 for global resolution and that scheduling for Plea and Sentencing in that matter would be scheduled by Branch 22  .  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 04-04-2014 at 08:30 am.
FILE UNAVAILABLE AT THE TIME OF THIS ENTRY.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Malik H or Delania A

Defendant Denasia N Danzy in court with attorney Jeffrey A Schwarz.  Defendant Denasia N Danzy in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
